ccb.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
ccb.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

cct.long_name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
cct.comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

cfc113global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
cfc113global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.

cfc11global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC11
cfc11global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3.  The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

cfc12global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
cfc12global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

ch4.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

ch4Clim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
ch4Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

ch4global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
ch4global.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

ch4globalClim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
ch4globalClim.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
ch4globalClim.comment: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

ci.long_name: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
ci.comment: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell.

cl.comment: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

cli.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. This is calculated as the mass of cloud ice in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. It includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clivi.comment: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clw.long_name: Mass Fraction of Cloud Liquid Water
clw.comment: Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. Calculate as the mass of cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cells. Precipitating hydrometeors are included ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvi.comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

co2.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2Clim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
co2Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2mass.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

co2massClim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
co2massClim.comment: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

evspsbl.comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

fco2antt.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to All Anthropogenic Emissions of CO2
fco2antt.comment: This is requested only for the emission-driven coupled carbon climate model runs.  Does not include natural fire sources but, includes all anthropogenic sources, including fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning, and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change excluding forest regrowth.

fco2fos.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2
fco2fos.comment: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

fco2nat.long_name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources
fco2nat.comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon  that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.

hcfc22global.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
hcfc22global.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.

hfls.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hur.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hurs.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

mc.comment: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  The flux is computed as the mass divided by the area of the grid cell.

n2o.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

n2oClim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
n2oClim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

n2oglobal.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

n2oglobalClim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
n2oglobalClim.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

o3.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

o3Clim.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years
o3Clim.comment: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

pfull.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

phalf.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within years time: mean over years

pr.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

prc.comment: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prsn.comment: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

ps.comment: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

rlds.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rlut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlutcs.comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

rsds.comment: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsdscs.comment: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdt.comment: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

rsus.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

rsut.comment: at the top of the atmosphere

rsutcs.comment: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rtmt.long_name: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model
rtmt.comment: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model : I.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.

sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

sci.long_name: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
sci.comment: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

tasmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: maximum within days time: mean over days
tasmax.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

tasmin.cell_methods: area: mean time: minimum within days time: mean over days
tasmin.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')

tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

uas.comment: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind

va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

vas.comment: Northward component of the near surface wind

wap.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
